basics.name: Richard Hendriks
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Full stack developer with 8+ years of experience building scalable web applications. Passionate about clean code, performance optimization, and open source. Led teams of 5-10 engineers at multiple startups. Strong background in distributed systems and real-time data processing.

work.name: Pied Piper
work.summary: Leading development of a revolutionary middle-out compression platform serving 2M+ daily active users.
highlights: Architected microservices migration reducing deployment time by 70%
Built real-time data pipeline processing 500K events/second
Mentored team of 5 junior developers, improving code review throughput by 40%
Implemented CI/CD pipeline with 95% test coverage requirement

work.name: Hooli
work.summary: Developed and maintained core platform features for enterprise cloud services.
highlights: Reduced API response times by 60% through caching and query optimization
Designed and implemented OAuth2 authentication system for 10M+ users
Led migration from monolithic architecture to event-driven microservices

work.name: Raviga Capital
work.summary: Built internal tools and dashboards for portfolio management.
highlights: Developed real-time portfolio tracking dashboard using React and D3.js
Automated reporting pipeline saving 20 hours/week of manual work

volunteer.summary: Built civic tech tools for local government transparency.
highlights: Developed open-source budget visualization tool used by 15 municipalities

courses: CS 161 - Design and Analysis of Algorithms

awards.title: TechCrunch Disrupt Winner
awards.summary: Won first place for middle-out compression algorithm demonstration

publications.name: Optimal Lossless Compression for Distributed Systems
publications.summary: A novel approach to middle-out compression achieving 3x better ratios than existing algorithms.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: Richard is the most talented developer I've ever worked with. His compression algorithm literally changed the industry. I would hire him again in a heartbeat â€” if I still had a company.

projects.name: PiperNet
projects.description: Decentralized internet platform built on middle-out compression
highlights: Scaled to 2M+ users in first 6 months
Open-sourced core compression library (5K+ GitHub stars)
